text: On 23 March 2022 in Somalia, four coordinated attacks by al-Shabaab jihadists in Mogadishu and Beledweyne killed at least 48 people. ==Attacks== ===Aden Adde International Airport shooting=== On 23 March, gunmen attacked Aden Adde International Airport in the Somali capital Mogadishu, killing five people. Two attackers also were killed. ===Beledweyne bombings=== The next attack happened a few hours later as Somali female Member of Parliament Amina Mohamed Abdi left a polling place in Beledweyne. A suicide bomber detonated his explosive vest, killing several people. Abdi died instantly. A car bomb was set off near a hospital, killing at least 30 people. The blast's impact was powerful, with the explosions destroying not only the hospital, but also nearby buildings and cars. At least 48 people were killed by the bombings and 108 others injured. ===Beledweyne restaurant attack=== Al-Shabaab militants attacked a restaurant in Beledweyne, killing the retired politician Hassan Dhuhul and many others. ==References== Category:2022 crimes in Africa Category:2020s building bombings Category:2020s explosions in Africa Category:2020s murders in Africa Category:Al-Shabaab (militant group) Category:Attacks on airports Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in 2022 Category:Attacks on restaurants Category:Building bombings in Africa Category:Car and truck bombings in Africa Category:Car and truck bombings in the 2020s Category:Explosions in 2022 Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in Africa Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in the 2020s Category:March 2022 events Category:Mass murder in Africa Category:Mass murder in 2022 Category:Mogadishu Category:Suicide bombings in Africa Category:Suicide bombings in the 2020s Category:Suicide in 2022 Category:Terrorist incidents in 2022 Category:Terrorist incidents in Africa in the 2020s
title: March 2022 Somalia attacks
